conclusion: Analyze the process on the PV diagram using given information.
Transition from D to A is a horizontal line on the PV diagram, indicating an isobaric process.
Pressure during the process from D to A is P1.
Work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Volume at state D is V2 and at state A is V1.
Change in volume ΔV is V1 - V2.
Substitute values into the work formula: W = P1 (V1 - V2).
Interpret the sign of the work done based on V1 and V2.
Final answer: Work done by the gas is W = P1 (V1 - V2).
